item.dc:creator: d723
item.description: On the form on the Admin>Options>Miscellaneous page, under "Track Link's Update Times", if you enter html tags in the in "Prepend updated with" and "Append updated with" fields, they turn into html special characters after you press the "Update Options" button.

item.title: Ticket #830 (Ability to moderate trackbacks) updated
item.dc:creator: Twyford
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #830 (Ability to moderate trackbacks) created
item.dc:creator: Twyford
item.description:
Today I was on the receiving end of a new type of blog spam: Trackback spam. The spammer has scripted a way to create trackbacks on posts showing spam links.

Wordpress needs a way to moderate trackbacks in the same way that comments are moderated. This will reduce the amount of these spam trackbacks which will start to increase.

item.title: Ticket #829 (Editing a post via XML-RPC fails, putting the post into Draft mode) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #829 (Editing a post via XML-RPC fails, putting the post into Draft mode) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
If I use XML-RPC to edit an existing post, I get an error (pasted below), and the post it bumped into Draft mode. I can create new posts via XML-RPC. I'm using MarsEdit 1.0 on MacOSX.

--- Error message from XML-RPC log:

XML-RPC message sent: 2005-02-06 13:16:35 -0700 URL: ​http://www.myfancyserver.net/xmlrpc.php Method name: metaWeblog.editPost Request text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <methodCall>

<methodName>metaWeblog.editPost</methodName> <params>

<param>

<value><string>549</string></value> </param>

<param>

<value><string>[username]</string></value> </param>

<param>

<value><string>[password]</string></value> </param>

<param>

<value> <struct> <member> <name>title</name> <value><string>Trying out MarsEdit (again)</string></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_text_more</name> <value><string></string></value> </member> <member> <name>description</name> <value><string>boring post deleted for sanity in mantis</string></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_allow_pings</name> <value><string>1</string></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_allow_comments</name> <value><int>1</int></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_keywords</name> <value><string></string></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_convert_breaks</name> <value><string>0</string></value> </member> <member> <name>mt_excerpt</name> <value><string></string></value> </member> </struct> </value> </param>

<param>

<value><boolean>0</boolean></value> </param>

</params>

</methodCall>

XML-RPC reply received: 2005-02-06 13:16:36 -0700 URL: ​http://www.myfancyserver.net/xmlrpc.php Method name: metaWeblog.editPost Status code: 200 Succeeded: NO --Fault Error-- Fault code: 500 Fault string: Sorry, your entry could not be edited. Something wrong happened. Response text: <?xml version="1.0"?> <methodResponse>

<fault>

<value>

<struct>

<member>

<name>faultCode</name> <value><int>500</int></value>

</member> <member>

<name>faultString</name> <value><string>Sorry, your entry could not be edited. Something wrong happened.</string></value>

</member>

</struct>

</value>

</fault>

</methodResponse>

item.dc:creator: gudlyf
item.description:
For now, to stop people from leaving iframes in comments, I had to add this to my-hacks.php:

add_filter('comment_text', 'wp_specialchars');

However, this affects all HTML left in comments.

Perhaps there's an easier way to define what HTML is allowed within comments?

item.title: Ticket #827 (get_postdata should not alter global $post array) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #827 (get_postdata should not alter global $post array) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #827 (get_postdata should not alter global $post array) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: get_postdata() called from user_can_edit_post() alters the global $post array, reloading post data into that variable in the middle of The Loop. This unsets any user-specified array elements that may have been set for use in the main loop. get_postdata() should only return the data required by the call and should not modify global variables.

item.title: Ticket #825 (Query based templates not fully armed/operational) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #825 (Query based templates not fully armed/operational) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
The following query based templates are not defined, though their corresponding is_ function is. (Note <a href="​http://boren.nu/archives/2004/10/16/templates-and-the-is-functions/">this</a> quasi-official document).

year.php month.php day.php time.php

(Perhaps they should be included as subcases of get_date_template.)

The paged template (NOT the page template) appears never to get referenced. Or rather, I have not found a case when it could be (being at the bottom of all the elseifs in wp-blog-header.php).

Also, it might be useful to some if the author template could be split into individual templates as can be done with the category template (author-1.php similar to category-1.php).

item.title: Ticket #785 (Replace is_plugin_page()/double loading with action hook) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
We could also have add_options_page() accept an optional arg that specifies a callback function to register. If this is passed, add_options_page() will do the add_action for you.

function options_page() {

echo "<h2>Test Options</h2>";

}

add_options_page('Test Options', 'Test Options', 8, FILE, 'options_page');

I like that. I'll update my patch.

edited on: 02-06-05 06:37

item.title: Changeset [2229]: Don't array_slice in loop. Move it up.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Don't array_slice in loop. Move it up.

item.title: Ticket #785 (Replace is_plugin_page()/double loading with action hook) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
I uploaded a new patch that basically does what Morgan's does but does not require modifying edit.php or options-general.php. Instead of targeting Management and Options, it applies generically to all menus. Here's the gist:

In menu.php, create an array of parent files and their page hooks. Their page hooks are created by running their menu titles through sanitize title.

In admin.php, look to see if a page hook is set for the given plugin and parent. If so, call the hook and exit.

In menu-header.php, instead of linking to the plugin page through admin.php, link through the parent file if a page hook is set. So, the old way of admin.php?page=plugin-page.php becomes edit.php?page=plugin-page.php. Since all admin pages load admin.php, all pages are capable of being used as a plugin page loader. admin.php is still used for those pages that do not specify hooks.

add_options_page() and add_management_page() return the plugin hook name for the page added. This hook can then be fed to add_action().

A sample plugin, menu-test.php, is attached.

edited on: 02-06-05 06:08

edited on: 02-06-05 06:09

item.title: Ticket #824 (Apostrophe in submitter name borks comment submission) updated
item.dc:creator: dnorman
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #824 (Apostrophe in submitter name borks comment submission) created
item.dc:creator: dnorman
item.description:
I've got an apostrophe in my name (D'Arcy), and on my weblog I've set up my user with that as the display name etc... I just went to add a comment to my weblog to respond to someone else's comment, and it looked like it was barfing pretty violently on the apostrophe. I took it out of my WP user (Changed firstname and display name to "DArcy"), and all was well... That may be coincidence, since I also removed the apostrophe from the comment submitter's name at one point.

I was able to comment successfully with the previous beta, but I just installed the latest gamma (1.5-gamma 2005-02-05) and now get an error.

Here's the error I got:

WordPress database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax. Check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'Arcy' AND comment_author_email = 'dlnorman@…' and com]<br /> SELECT comment_approved FROM wp_comments WHERE comment_author = 'D'Arcy' AND comment_author_email = 'dlnorman@…' and comment_approved = '1'

WordPress database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax. Check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'Arcy', 'dlnorman@…', '​http://www.darcynorman.net]<br /> INSERT INTO wp_comments (comment_post_ID, comment_author, comment_author_email, comment_author_url, comment_author_IP, comment_date, comment_date_gmt, comment_content, comment_approved, comment_agent, comment_type, user_id) VALUES ('547', 'D'Arcy', 'dlnorman@…', '​http://www.darcynorman.net', 'IP_ADDRESS_REMOVED', '2005-02-05 18:57:32', '2005-02-06 01:57:32', 'testing comment submission', '0', 'Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/125.5.6 (KHTML, like Gecko) Safari/125.12', , '2')

item.title: Ticket #813 (Issues with recognizing WP user for comments) updated
item.dc:creator: gbhugo
item.description:
a patch:

--- wordpress/wp-comments-post.php Thu Feb 3 21:53:01 2005 +++ hugo.muensterland.org/wordpress/wp-comments-post.php Sat Feb 5 14:31:18 2005 @@ -21,9 +21,9 @@

If the user is logged in get_currentuserinfo(); if ( $user_ID ) :

  • $comment_author = $user_login;

+ $comment_author = $user_identity;

$comment_author_email = $user_email;

  • $comment_author_url = str_replace('​http://', , $user_url);

+ $comment_author_url = $user_url;

else :

if ( get_option('comment_registration') )

die( ('Sorry, you must be logged in to post a comment.') );

item.title: Ticket #807 (wp-admin/edit.php: comment_status missing for comment table) updated
item.dc:creator: gbhugo
item.description:
I get the same problem when I try to edit comments to just one posting:

WordPress database error: [Unknown column 'comment_status' in 'where clause'] SELECT * FROM wp_comments WHERE comment_post_ID = 4173 AND comment_status != 'spam' ORDER BY comment_date

The reason might be that the field actually is named comment_approved, not comment_status (comment_status is in the wp_posts table). The patch:

--- wordpress/wp-admin/edit.php Fri Feb 4 18:42:16 2005 +++ hugo.muensterland.org/wordpress/wp-admin/edit.php Sat Feb 5 14:27:22 2005 @@ -167,7 +167,7 @@

<?php if ( 1 == count($posts) ) {

item.description: Under page write and page management there are options for Comments and Trackbacks yet they don't show up under the Default theme but they do under the Classic theme. The page management area also doesn't show the number of comments/trackbacks though.

item.title: Ticket #813 (Issues with recognizing WP user for comments) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #813 (Issues with recognizing WP user for comments) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
The functionality where the currently logged in user is recognized by WP when that user submits a comment needs some fixing:

in wp-comments-post.php:

24 $comment_author = $user_login; 25 $comment_author_email = $user_email; 26 $comment_author_url = str_replace('​http://', , $user_url);

on line 24, instead of $user_login, we should use $user_identity (for instance, the $user_login could be all lower case, or something entirely different.)

Also, why is '​http://' stripped out?

item.title: Ticket #108 (I get an XML Parsing Error whenever i got to my journals rss feeds) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I located a fix for this in the wordpress support forums ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=13097

for rss2 - open the file wp-rss2.php from the wp root for commentsrss2 - open file pwp-commentsrss2.php from wp root

find

header('Content-type: text/xml', true);

and replace with

header('Content-type: application/xml', true);

This has resolved the problem for wp-rss2.php and wp-commentsrss2.php and this issue is now mostly resolved. Thank you.

-ejm

edit: the fix does not appear to work for wp-rss.php

item.title: Ticket #812 (Options->Reading UI has misleading section) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #812 (Options->Reading UI has misleading section) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
The "Pages" section of the Options->Reading SubPanel may be misleading to people new to 1.5; it could be taken as referring to the new Page feature (as in Write->Write Page).

"Paging Options" or "Pagination" might be better.
